hints.content: Let's try each strategy one at a time to see if they work.

Add $38+2$ then add $33$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{38}+\purpleC{36}&=\greenD{38}+\purpleC{2}+\purpleC{34}\\
&\ne \greenD{38}+\purpleC{2}+\redD{33}\\
\end{align}$

>No, this strategy does **not** work.

Add $30+30$ then add $8$ then add $6$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{38}+\purpleC{36}&=\greenD{30}+\greenD{8}+\purpleC{30}+\purpleC6\\
&= \greenD{30}+\purpleC{30}+\greenD{8}+\purpleC{6}\\
\end{align}$

>Yes, this strategy works.

**The following strategy can be used to add $38+36$.**

- Add $30+30$ then add $8$ then add $6$.

question.content:
**Select any strategy that can be used to add $38+36$.**
